tit.e: Utsuho Monogatari (The tale of the Cavern)
Utsuho Monogatari (The tale of the Cavern)
Utsuho Monogatari (The tale of the Cavern)

sen.j: うつほ物語（『宇津保物語』と表記されることもある）は、日本の平安時代中期に成立した長編物語。
sen.e: Utsuho Monogatari ("うつほ物語," sometimes entitled "宇津保物語") is a full-length tale written in the mid Heian period in Japan.
Utsuho Monogatari ("うつほ物語," sometimes entitled "宇津保物語") is a full-length tale written in the mid Heian period in Japan.
Utsuho Monogatari ("うつほ物語," sometimes entitled "宇津保物語") is a full-length tale written in the mid Heian period in Japan.

sen.j: 全二十巻、著者は不明だが源順説などがある。
sen.e: The story consists of twenty volumes, and although the author is unknown, MINAMOTO no Shitago is said to be a likely candidate.
The story consists of twenty volumes, and although the author is unknown, MINAMOTO no Shitago is said to be a likely candidate.
The story consists of twenty volumes, and although the author is unknown, MINAMOTO no Shitago is said to be a likely candidate.

sen.j: 『竹取物語』にみられた伝奇的性格を受け継ぎ、日本文学史上最古の長編物語である。
sen.e: It inherits the characteristics of a tale of fantastic found in "Taketori Monogatari" (the Tale of Bumboo Cutter), and is the oldest full-length tale in the Japanese literature.
It inherits the characteristics of a tale of fantasy found in "Taketori Monogatari" (the Tale of Bumboo Cutter), and is the oldest full-length tale in Japanese literature.
It inherits the characteristics of a tale of fantasy found in "Taketori Monogatari" (the Tale of Bamboo Cutter), and is the oldest full-length tale in Japanese literature.

sen.j: 写実的な描写などは『源氏物語』の成立へ影響を与えたと言われている。
sen.e: It is said that its realistic description influenced the writing of "The Tale of Genji."
It is said that its realistic description influenced the writing of "The Tale of Genji."
It is said that its realistic description influenced the writing of "The Tale of Genji."

sen.j: 当時の貴族にとって、その演奏が教養でもあった楽器のひとつ「琴」の音楽をめぐって物語が展開していく。
sen.e: The story develops around the music of a 'koto' (Japanese traditinal harp), which is one of the musical instruments whose players were considered to be educated persons in the nobles at that time.
The story develops around the music of a 'koto' (Japanese traditinal harp), which is one of the musical instruments whose players were considered to be educated persons among the nobles at that time.

The story develops around the music of a 'koto' (Japanese traditional harp), which is one of the musical instruments whose players were considered to be educated persons among the nobles at that time.

sen.j: 当時の年中行事を記した日記的な記述が多くみられる点も特徴のひとつである。
sen.e: It is also one of the characteristics that there are many descriptions like a diary which recorded the annual events at that time.
Another one of the characteristics is that there are many descriptions, in the manner of a diary which recorded the annual events at that time.
Another one of the characteristics is that there are many descriptions, in the manner of a diary which recorded the annual events at that time.

sen.j: 遣唐使清原俊蔭は渡唐の途中で難破のため波斯国（ペルシア）へ漂着する。
sen.e: KIYOHARA no Toshikage is sent to the Tang Dinasty China as a Kentoshi, but is shipwrecked on the way and drifts ashore on Persia.
KIYOHARA no Toshikage is sent to the Tang Dinasty China as a Kentoshi, but is shipwrecked on the way and drifts ashore on Persia.
KIYOHARA no Toshikage is sent to the Tang Dynasty China as a Kentoshi, but is shipwrecked on the way and drifts ashore on Persia.

sen.j: 天人・仙人から秘琴の技を伝えられた俊蔭は、23年を経て日本へ帰着した。
sen.e: Toshikage obtains the essence of the hikin (the magical harps) from the heavenly being and mountain hermit, and after twenty three years he comes back to Japan.
Toshikage obtains the essence of the hikin (the magical harps) from a heavenly being and a mountain hermit, and after twenty-three years he comes back to Japan.
Toshikage obtains the essence of the hikin (the magical harps) from a heavenly being and a mountain hermit, and after twenty-three years he comes back to Japan.

sen.j: 俊蔭は官職を辞して、娘へ秘琴と清原家の再興を託した後に死んだ。
sen.e: Toshikage resigns from the government office, and after entrusting his daughter the hikin and the revival of the Kiyohara family he dies.
Toshikage resigns from the government office, and after entrusting his daughter with the hikin and the revival of the Kiyohara family, he dies.
Toshikage resigns from the government office, and after entrusting his daughter with the hikin and the revival of the Kiyohara family, he dies.

sen.j: 俊蔭の娘は、太政大臣の子息（藤原兼雅）との間に子をもうけたが、貧しさをかこち、北山の森の木の空洞 - うつほで子（藤原仲忠）を育てながら秘琴の技を教えた。
sen.e: Toshikage's daughter bears a child to FUJIWARA no Kanemasa who is a son of the Daijo-daijin (Grand minister of state), but as she is very poor, in the cavern of the tree in the forest of Kitayama she raises up her child (FUJIWARA no Nakatada) and teaches him the essence of the hikin.

Toshikage's daughter bears a child to FUJIWARA no Kanemasa, who is a son of the Daijo-daijin (Grand minister of state), but as she is very poor, in the cavern of a tree in the forest of Kitayama she raises up her child (FUJIWARA no Nakatada) and teaches him the essence of the hikin.

Toshikage's daughter bears a child to FUJIWARA no Kanemasa, who is a son of the Daijo-daijin (Grand minister of state), but as she is very poor, in the cavern of a tree in the forest of Kitayama she raises up her child (FUJIWARA no Nakatada) and teaches him the essence of the hikin.

sen.j: 兼雅は二人と再会し、仲忠を引き取った。
sen.e: Kanemasa meets the two of them again, and takes Nakatada in.
Kanemasa meets the two of them again, and takes Nakatada in.
Kanemasa meets the two of them again, and takes Nakatada in.

sen.j: 〔俊陰〕
sen.e: 〔Toshikage〕
〔Toshikage〕
〔Toshikage〕

sen.j: そのころ、源正頼娘の貴宮（あて宮）が大変な評判で求婚者が絶えなかった。
sen.e: In those days, MINAMOTO no Masayori's daughter, Atemiya, has an excellent reputation and there are continuous proposals for marriage.
In those days, MINAMOTO no Masayori's daughter, Atemiya, has an excellent reputation and there are continuous proposals for marriage.
In those days, MINAMOTO no Masayori's daughter, Atemiya, has an excellent reputation and there are continuous proposals for marriage.

sen.j: 求婚者には春宮（皇太子）、仲忠、源涼、源実忠、源仲純、上野宮、三春高基らがいたが続々と脱落し、互いにライバルと認める仲忠と涼が宮中で見事な秘琴の勝負を繰りひろげたものの、結局、あて宮は春宮に入内し、飛香舎と呼ばれるようになった。
sen.e: The proposers include Togu (the Crown Prince), Nakatada, MINAMOTO no Suzushi, MINAMOTO no Sanetada, MINAMOTO no Nakasumi, Ueno no miya, and Takamoto MIHARU, most of whom fall behind one after another, and although Nakatada and Suzushi who recognize each other as a rival have a match of the fantastic hikin in the Imperial court, Atemiya enters into the Togu's court and gets to be called a Higyosha (one of the royal halls).

The proposers include Togu (the Crown Prince), Nakatada, MINAMOTO no Suzushi, MINAMOTO no Sanetada, MINAMOTO no Nakasumi, Ueno no miya, and Takamoto MIHARU, most of whom fall behind one after another, and although Nakatada and Suzushi, who recognize each other as rivals, have a match of the fantastic hikin in the Imperial court, Atemiya enters the Togu's court and gets to be called a Higyosha (one of the royal halls).

The proposers include Togu (the Crown Prince), Nakatada, MINAMOTO no Suzushi, MINAMOTO no Sanetada, MINAMOTO no Nakasumi, Ueno no miya, and Takamoto MIHARU, most of whom fall behind one after another, and although Nakatada and Suzushi, who recognize each other as rivals, have a match of the fantastic hikin in the Imperial court, Atemiya enters the Togu's court and gets to be called a Higyosha (one of the royal halls).

sen.j: 〔藤原の君〜あて宮〕
sen.e: 〔FUJIWARA no KIMI 〜 Atemiya〕
〔FUJIWARA no KIMI 〜 Atemiya〕
〔FUJIWARA no KIMI to Atemiya〕

sen.j: 仲忠は女一宮と結婚し、その間に娘の犬宮（いぬ宮）が生まれた。
sen.e: Nakatada marries Onna Ichinomiya, and they have a daughter named Inumiya.
Nakatada marries Onna Ichinomiya, and they have a daughter named Inumiya.
Nakatada marries Onna Ichinomiya, and they have a daughter named Inumiya.

sen.j: 俊蔭娘は帝に見いだされ内侍司となる。
sen.e: Toshikage's daughter is recognized by the Emperor, and becomes Naishi no tsukasa (one of the female palace attendants).
Toshikage's daughter is recognized by the Emperor, and becomes Naishi no tsukasa (one of the female palace attendants).
Toshikage's daughter is recognized by the Emperor, and becomes Naishi no tsukasa (one of the female palace attendants).

sen.j: 仲忠は大納言へ昇進し、春宮は新帝に、藤壺腹の皇子が春宮になった。
sen.e: Nakatada is promoted to Dainagon (a chief councillor of state), and Togu bocomes the new Emperor and the prince whose mother is Fujitsubo becomes Togu.
Nakatada is promoted to Dainagon (a chief councillor of state), and Togu bocomes the new Emperor and the prince, whose mother is Fujitsubo, becomes Togu.
Nakatada is promoted to Dainagon (a chief councillor of state), and Togu becomes the new Emperor and the prince, whose mother is Fujitsubo, becomes Togu.

sen.j: 〔蔵開・上〜国譲・下〕
sen.e: 〔Kurabiraki (jo) 〜 Kuniyuzuri (ge)〕
〔Kurabiraki (jo) 〜 Kuniyuzuri (ge)〕
〔Kurabiraki (jo) to Kuniyuzuri (ge)〕

sen.j: 仲忠は母にいぬ宮へ秘琴を伝えるようお願いし、いぬ宮は琴の秘技を身につける。
sen.e: Nakatada asks his mother to initiate Inumiya into the secret of the hikin, and Inumiya masters the special technique of the hikin
Nakatada asks his mother to initiate Inumiya into the secret of the hikin, and Inumiya masters the special technique of the hikin
Nakatada asks his mother to initiate Inumiya into the secret of the hikin, and Inumiya masters the special technique of the hikin

sen.j: いぬ宮は2人の上皇、嵯峨院と朱雀院を邸宅に招いて秘琴を披露し、一同に深い感動を与えるシーンで物語は終わる。
sen.e: Inumiya invites two of the Retired Emperors, Saga no in and Suzaku no in, to her residence to perform the hikin, and makes a deep impression on all of the gests, the scene of which is the end of the tale.
Inumiya invites two of the Retired Emperors, Saga no in and Suzaku no in, to her residence to perform the hikin, and makes a deep impression on all of the guests; this scene is the end of the tale.
Inumiya invites two of the Retired Emperors, Saga no in and Suzaku no in, to her residence to perform the hikin, and makes a deep impression on all of the guests; this scene is the end of the tale.

sen.j: 〔楼上・上〜下〕
sen.e: 〔Ro no Ue (jo) 〜 Ro no Ue (ge)〕
〔Ro no Ue (jo) 〜 Ro no Ue (ge)〕
〔Ro no Ue (jo) to Ro no Ue (ge)〕

sen.j: 『うつほ物語』は各巻に独自の名称を施した全20巻で構成される。
sen.e: "Utsuho Monogatari" is composed of twenty volumes in all, and each of them has a unique title.
"Utsuho Monogatari" is composed of twenty volumes in all, and each of them has a unique title.
"Utsuho Monogatari" is composed of twenty volumes in all, and each of them has a unique title.

sen.j: 一部の巻には写本によって別名を持つものもある。
sen.e: Some of the volumes of the manuscripts have another title.
Some of the volumes of the manuscripts have another title.
Some of the volumes of the manuscripts have another title.

sen.j: また、巻の配列の順序も現代語訳作品や注釈書によって差異がある。
sen.e: Also, some of the translations into present-day Japanese or the annotated books are different in the orders of the volumes.
Also, some of the translations into present-day Japanese or the annotated books differ in the order of the volumes.
Also, some of the translations into present-day Japanese or the annotated books differ in the order of the volumes.

sen.j: ここでは各巻の名称、配列順とも岩波書店の『宇津保物語 一〜三』（日本古典文学大系巻10-12、河野多麻校注）に従った（読みがなは現代仮名遣いとした）。
sen.e: This article shows both the titles and the order of the volumes according to "Utsuho Monogatari 1 ～ 3" (Iwanami Shoten, Japanese Classic Literature Systematic Edition Vols. 10 ～ 12, revised and annotated by Tama KONO) (Letters' reading is expressed with the modern kana usage).

This article shows both the titles and the order of the volumes according to "Utsuho Monogatari 1 ～ 3" (Iwanami Shoten, Japanese Classic Literature Systematic Edition Vols. 10 ～ 12, revised and annotated by Tama KONO) (Letters' readings are expressed with the modern kana usage).

This article shows both the titles and the order of the volumes according to "Utsuho Monogatari 1 to 3" (Iwanami Shoten, Japanese Classic Literature Systematic Edition Vols. 10 to 12, revised and annotated by Tama KONO) (Letters' readings are expressed with the modern kana usage).
